# LayerRenderer.Frame.Timing

**Structure**

A type that stores information about a frame’s encoding, rendering, and presentation deadlines.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Timing
```

## Overview

Before you start drawing your frame’s content, call [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Frame/predictTiming()] to retrieve the frame’s timing information. That function returns the latest predicted values for you to use during planning. After you retrieve the [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Drawable] type for the frame, get the timing information from the drawable instead using [doc://com.apple.compositorservices/documentation/CompositorServices/LayerRenderer/Drawable/frameTiming].

## Updating the frame contents

- **optimalInputTime**: The optimal time to start the frame submission process.

## Rendering the frame

- **renderingDeadline**: The time at which you must finish all work for the specified frame.

## Displaying the frame

- **presentationTime**: The time at which the system displays the frame onscreen.

## Creating the timing details

- **init()**

## Instance Properties

- **trackableAnchorTime**

## Getting timing information

- **predictTiming()**: Computes and returns the predicted timing information for the frame.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
